doc.previous: The film tells the story of a street gang of children who terrorize their impoverished neighborhood, at one point brutalizing a blind man[140] and at another assaulting a legless man who moves around on a dolly, which they toss down a hill.[141] Film historian Carl J. Mora has said of Los olvidados that the director: "visualized poverty in a radically different way from the traditional forms of Mexican melodrama.
